newsitem.title: USA: Gap shares fall ahead of Sept sales report.
newsitem.headline: Gap shares fall ahead of Sept sales report.

text.p: Gap Inc shares fell in anticipation of softer September sales figures, which are expected to be reported on Thursday, analysts said.

Shares of Gap fell 1-1/8 to 28. A Gap spokesperson was not available but analysts said the stock fell on views that sales comparisons are becoming increasingly challenging, particularly after August's flat same store sales.

"I think the Gap will have a relatively soft number on Thursday," said Donald Trott of Dean Witter Reynolds. "August numbers spooked a lot of people and the stock got hit hard, but we think that was just the first tremor."
Trott said there were still many "momentum players" holding onto the stock but these investors' tolerance levels for further disappointments from the Gap were relatively low.
Another analyst said, "I don't think there are high expectations for the month. Everybody's digested the fact that sales of the first part of September were difficult."
Late last month, Morgan Stanley & Co analyst Sharon Pearson downgraded Gap on views that its sales gains would be weaker during the rest of the year than in the spring and summer.
